titleStmt.title: A short treatise of the reason and cause why our mony [and] bullion have been exported for many years last past. With the way to prevent it for the future, and make mony more plentiful, vvithout raising the coyn. To which is added, something concerning the exchange, which is risen so high, that 'tis considerable profit at this time, to bring guinea's and mill'd mony from Holland. By a Well-wisher to England's prosperity.
titleStmt.author: Well-wisher to England's prosperity.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for E. Whitlock, near Stationers-Hall,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Goldsmith's Library, University of London.
